abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Debt and Debt Service Reduction (DDSR)
            operation in Poland. The objective of this operation was to
            support the DDSR agreement reached between Poland and its
            commercial creditors. Bank's performance was highly
            satisfactory. Borrower's performance was highly
            satisfactory. The key lessons learned were as follows: (i)
            since the debtor country will incur high up-front costs, it
            makes more sense for DDSR operations to follow rather than
            lead the country's economic reform process; (ii) DDSR
            operations provide significant indirect benefits by
            restoring the country's access to international capital
            markets; (iii) voluntary market-based solutions to the debt
            crisis are strictly preferred to mandatory solutions, strong
            signals from the international community regarding the
            expected level of debt and debt service reduction can be
            beneficial to ensure an operation that strengthens the
            country's growth prospects. Finally, to reduce the
            sensitivity of options to short-term market conditions, it
            could be worthwhile to design more flexible instruments that
            would help maintain a balance among them at the time the
            final selection is made.
